column4: This was our first time stay here, although I did stay at the next door Hilton once before. I must say the staff here were all Supa amazing & gave us a customer deserving treatment of note! They acted on every request and delivered even more than requested. We need to mention the staff at reception that assisted us in making other reservations for us at other hotels and arranging our tours to changing the reservations at this hotel. They made great suggestions for us & made our holiday much more value four our money. Thanks to Lubnah, Wiam & Reda for your help, much appreciated. Our friendly staff at restaurant @ breakfast for taking special care of us, you are Supa stars & have great futures in your industry. We wish you success and climbing the ladders of success in your…

Very clean clean hotel I felt so safe and comfortable. The location is perfect near by the beach. I am a Hilton honor gold member and I got special attention open arrival from the reception team, I got free upgrade to the sea view room. The bed was very comfortable and the room so clean. During the breakfast we were welcome by fatima zahra and we got very special treat from Mr.mohamed the chef leader. And the very kind girl rajae. They are a golden stars of the hotel. Thank you Hilton.

Our stay in Hilton Garden Inn was amazing. Amazing staff was extremely very helpful. They did the best to make us feel home. Breakfast was amazing. The best breakfast I have ever had in a hotel. Fresh ingredients and local tastes. Location is very good just close to gare and walking distance to many places.

column3: Very Good Location, Close to 5 Star Experience
column4: Stayed here for 1 night. We are Hilton Gold, so when we booked our twin room, city view, we knew we would get a little upgrade. We arrived and we had a corner Sea View room. The Room was really spacious. The room was clean amd we loved it. The location was awesome, 5 mins from the coast, 5 from a mall and 5 from the train station. Best Location we could ask for! 1 Minor, just Minor issue was the shower. Their Hot water was warm, and the pressure was a little lacking. I had better showers in the Sahara, but it did not really ruin the Experience. Breakfast. Wow. Complimentary, and a HUGE variety of food. All of them were really good and clean. Just a few improvements could be made here for breakfast. First was the staff? We went in, sat down and ate. Roughly 20 minutes, right…

Very nice and quiet room on the Tangier beachfront. The room with sea view has a great view, by day and night. Very friendly staff that makes Hilton members feel very welcome. The breakfast buffet is great with a large variety of products, including a Moroccan corner

The hotel, staff and all the amenities were on par for Hilton and its standards, above the rest as usual. Everything was clean, updated. We had a magnificent view of the sea and coastline. We chose the sea view room. The breakfast buffet was incredible, Ibrahim and Fatima took excellent care of us. It was a 5 minute walk from the train station, and a few minutes walk to the beach. Excellent location, right next to the mall. The nearest mosque was a quick taxi ride away for about a dollar. Would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Tangier.

great hotel with amazing view, we really enjoyed our stay in this amazing hotel the rooms are very clean and the service is great, we loved our view from the window to see the amazing beauty big thanks to the reception guy he was always there to provide help

We were late for breakfast Rajaa and Fatima went out of their way to make sure we were looked after, even tho the kitchen was closing Rajaa went and spoke to the chef and got us hot breakfast ...amazing service from Rajaa, Fatima and somaya

I stayed in this amazing hotel on my last trip to Tangier, the hotel is amazing, the services are on the top level, we really enjoyed our stay there, I highly recommend this hotel for everyone visiting the city for holidays top hotel in top city.

column3: Rust at bathtub, dried feces at toilet bowl
column4: Hotel not meet Hilton standards of cleaning and quality. We got dirty room, whit rust at bathtub. Toilet bowl is dirty with dried feces. This is disgusting!!! Completely disappointed with cleaning. Staff not helpful. Beware of this hotel! We paid high price for low quality hotel!

I stayed here while touring Morocco. It was a pleasant change from riads and old world medina hotels. Large simply furnished clean room with a view of the Mediterranean over neighbouring roof tops. I enjoyed a bar that served beer and an amazing international breakfast buffet. Well located between the train station and the beach. Only issue for me was not being asked at check in if I wanted a non smoking room and ending up in a late 20th century time warp!

Great location located close to the beach (across the street). Adjacent to the tangier city center mall. Amazing views from the room. Service was good. Breakfast was excellent with wide variety of choice from standard to Moroccan fare. Enjoyed the stay. Front desk staff was very welcoming and helpful. Parking available on site.

Stayed here on our last night in Morocco. It's located only a very short walk from the foreshore promenade & next door to a shopping centre. The rooms are very nice, good WiFi and friendly staff. Breakfast as good with plenty to choose from. Comfortable night sleep,coffee and tea facilitiesin the room & free water bottles... recommended.

1 night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. The front desk made check in quick and painless. My family had the king bed with pull out sofa. The room was clean and well decorated. We ate at the restaurant for dinner and it was amazing food and service. Hotel is beside the Tanger City Mall and Tangier Beach. Hotel is a 10 euro taxi from the ferry terminal. Although no fault of the hotel, I was really looking forward to spending 2 days in Tangier however we ended up leaving on an earlier ferry the next morning as I found Tangier to be a bit seedy and was followed around throughout the city. Although beautiful with lots of potential the city is dirty and hazardous especially with small children. The hotel was a nice reprieve from the harassment and a nice place to let your guard…

As an old Hilton client, it's all the time a pleasure to stay in Hilton Garden Inn Tangier. Everything was good as usually, even with the high season and the pressure on the different services I highly recommend it!

The service is excellent. Despite the volume of people, you can definitely feel the personalized attention. I want to point out that Rajae, the breakfast manager, is amazing! She totally went out of her way to make sure that our visit was the best! Rajae, The food and beverage manager, was also amazing. Yes, they share the same name! If you have followed my reviews, you know that I always give the good, the bad, and the ugly. Read this whole review all the way through to the end. To be honest, the beginning of our stay was horrible. I frequently stay at a different chain and have the highest level with them because I travel a lot for work. I'm accustomed to arriving and just having my room be ready. We got here around noon and we were told they didn't normally have rooms…

Beautiful rooms with an amazing view, impeccable service, convenient location at the heart of the city, few min walk from train station. Nice breakfast and dining experience at hotel restaurant Kasbah. Very courteous staff, especially Mohamed, Firdaws and Fahd

small rooms , but good location and clean . Was expecting a much better breakfast experience in terms of variety especially for the cost of the hotel rates. Also this hotel ONLY has 3 lifts !!! It can be very very painstaking . Breakfast staff were very very good with their service . Was asked what room I’m staying in by front security which I found very odd seeing as they were constantly seeing me in and out . Not very pushchair friendly the security staff at times would have to lift the pushchair when coming in . The area around is very very busy with locals due to the train station and McDonald beach area . Decent hotel I wouldn’t stay again at this particular hotel but would recommend to others

High class hotel-loved the breakfast most of all! Especially since this is Ramadan season and most places are closed! The only thing I would change is the fact that the coffee must be delivered by the waitresses which if you drink a bunch of coffee can be kind of frustrating because you have to keep asking for it-but other than that it was awesome with great variety of breakfast foods and very beautiful atmosphere!

I will begin with the pros : Very comfortable bed, spacious room, excellent location (next to the main mall, and a few minutes walking distance to the beach). Excellent cleaning service, the cleaning lady was very nice and welcoming. We asked her for 2 extra bottles of water on the first and second day, she started giving us 2 extra ones almost every day without us seeing her or asking. Very good service - the rooms were always cleaned with no issues. The staff decorated the room with flowers for our honeymoon which was very lovely. Upon arriving, however, we were meant to be put in a sea-view room but were put in a city-view - but the staff quickly moved us to a sea-view by the next day. This was not that big of an issue. Cons: The main issue I had is that me and my wife…

Nicely located, comfortable Hilton along the waterfront. friendly, helpful staff and a breakfast buffet that was incredible. they will make you fresh omelets, crepes, etc and a buffet of fresh fruits, vegetables, meats, cheese, juice, etc. I would recommend

being a regular visitor of this hotel can only say just book as it will meet all your expectations. Hiltons staff members are extremely professional, friendly and helpful, which makes your stay business or otherwise a pleasure.

Everything was nice , the room is very clean , comfortable bed. the location is perfect , just near the beach , restaurants , mall and train station. I recommend it. And I will surely return there next time.

First of all, I thank the Hilton Garden Hotel Management for their kind hospitality.Hilton Garden Hotel at Tangier is a nice hotel and the staff are very accommodating.Especially, the receptionist Madam Laila is outstanding among them. She is always conscious of the guest needs and quickly address them on time.She is indeed a caring receptionist and a hotelier that deserve to be motivated by any means possible.I am recommending her promotion as a way of motivating her to continue to do her very best for Hilton Garden Hotel. I thank you all. Momodou Saidyleigh Head of Aquaculture and Inland Fisheries Department of Fisheries Banjul The Gambia email: msaidyleigh1972@gmail.com WhatsApp +2207085931

rooms and location are ok even though hotel's environment, safety are really compromised, due to noises the sleep quality is very bad. It's the only hotel in Tanger which hotel's staff (reception and safety guards) let local people get in, to blackmail and extort money from guest. STAY SAFE AND CHOOSE A DIFFERENT HOTEL!!!

Good location, you can walk walk along the cornice, Cinema at fire metres , station train also . service is at average. Issue happened in the room : it was a piece of glasses on the ground caused injuries on my foot.

We arrived and dinner was cold. Some of the kitchen staff were so unfriendly and basically were not very helpful. We asked the waiter 3 times for butter and after 20 minutes and 3 attempts to get butter we left. The room was nice and clean. Everything else was good.

I really liked the hotel, its location near the train station and city mall , the staff was professional and so nice.. everything is satisfactory and comfortable We had a lovely double view :a seaview and a city view .

column3: Nice hotel with clean rooms and very good food at perfectly reasonable prices, and friendly staff.
column4: Great first impression of Morocco, and our server Anouar made us feel very welcome. If you've not eaten much in the way of Maghrébine cuisine, take the harira soup and lamb couscous. Don't forget to order the mint tea and some traditional sweets to finish up your meal You won't regret it. Definitely recommend.

column3: Very nice accommodation with a very attentive staff.
column4: The front desk staff was very friendly and took extra steps to assure I was comfortable. They were working on the concession area and the ice maker was in a construction area. The girl at the front desk took my insulated cup from me and took it to the bar for ice when I arrived at the front desk. She could have pointed me in that direction but she made sure I was taken care of. A small detail but it made a big impression on me.

We spent three nights in this hotel and would happily have stayed longer.location is a short walk from the beach , shops and restaurants. The check in and out was extremely friendly and efficient as was baggage and parking services which definitely gives a welcoming feeling. The property is fairly standard Hilton being very European in presentation as was the room (1401) . Facilities in the room were more than adequate with a very comfortable bed with nice crisp white linen. The bathroom was of a similar standard with good water pressure pleasant toiletries and nice quality towels. There is a gym which was adequate but missing some standard accessories, but was nevertheless suitable for our purposes. Breakfast is available as an extra charge or inclusively depending on the…

I had problem in my room with my guest, manager of reception and security, in stead of getting out my guest from the hotel, protect me and call the police, they advised me to pay extra money to hide and end up the story. In addition reception manager has clearly breaked the global privacy statment, sharing my personal sensitive information with my company about this matter.

I went to tangier for one week. Hilton gardens inn was our place for the week. Reception was small. Enough when low swason, but could be congested during high season. Staff were good. Our room was comfortable. Amenitires were good. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was very good, good varities bit not very wide. Resturant staff were good. After two nights stay we requested changing our room for sea view. Lady in the reception was hesitant, but the gentleman mohammd gave us the room. View was great. Housekeeping were great. Room service was good. At time of checkout, the lady in reception gave me the wrong bill. It took me a while to convince here, it was not iur bill. After paying the bill, she did not cancel the deposit I signed for at time of reception, and I had to remind…

column3: It Was Impossible To Sleep Due to Loud Noise!!! Beware!!!!
column4: I was initially very happy to book a two day stay at the Hilton Garden Inn for a business trip . unfortunely and very much to my dismay I was very disappointed to find that that moroccan Covid Curfew was not respected: there was a loud party with music until very late which was incredibly detrimental to me as I needed to be up by 6 am for work. I was so lost, I called front desk but nothing was done, I literally cried myself to sleep. I will never be coming back here.

The hotel is a five minute walk from train station, beach, and mall. A short taxi ride gets you to the Medina or walk along the beach for about 35 minutes to the Medina. Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful.

Very good location and clean facility. Restaurant food was excellent. All Hilton service team - front desk to cleaning service always ready to help. Also having laundry at building was a plus for long time stay.

column3: Staff was Great - Everything else Meh
column4: Staff is much better then the people next door. Room was ok. People yelling next door all night complained three times but never got moved. Shower is cold water, no hot water Breakfast - I skipped it no one wears masks and kids running around touching and coughing everywhere. Buffets should really be closed down during this time. Room view was amazing and stuff top notch.

column3: BEST HOTEL SERVICE IN TANGIERS/MORROCCO MOHAMED is a true legend
column4: Mohamed Zitouni is absolutely amazing guy he is the most nicest - friendliest - helpful person you will ever meet at the Hilton hotel. I went with my family and had the best 4 days of my life such lovely hotel & beautiful people. Mohamed Zitouni is the most nicest guy you will ever meet, I have stayed in many hotels in my life but never received such good service from any other hotel It was such good experience that I will be staying at Hilton hotels anytime I go on holiday in the future because of MOHAMED Zitouni true legend

column3: Unacceptable service at restaurant from one employee
column4: I was there at the end of February 2020 to attend a conference. The good at the restaurant was ok but the behavior and attitude of one junior restaurant "supervisor" (should I say a "janitor") one evening at 9 PM spoiled everything. He did not show any consideration or respect for me at the time of checkout and almost treated me as a thief. I was shocked and everybody else who was present was shocked. I am not sure if this young pretentious employee was sanctioned or not but there is a clear problem of training and recruitment. On the other hand, I did not receive apologies from the General Manager.

I was VERY Satisfied during my stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Tanger. The Staff, the helpfulnes, the overall impresion is all to a 10 star rating. I will defently be using this hotel the next time i am in Tanger.

Check-in : checked in after a very long day (on an organized tour and full day spent on bus). The reception desk was very busy but we were put through relatively quickly. Reception offers cool glass of flavoured water while they are processing your check in. Room: Room large and comfortable. Bed and pillows were both great. Restaurant: The best part of the experience. We had dinner and breakfast included in our rate as part of an organized tour. At dinner, we were asked to choose between the international and Moroccan menus. We chose the Moroccan. It was clear that the server was very pleased that we wanted to try Moroccan food. We ordered tagines and couscous as well as a Moroccan wine that the server recommended. Everything was delicious. Since we were interested…

We arrived and dinner was cold. Some of the kitchen staff were so unfriendly and basically were not very helpful. We asked the waiter 3 times for butter and after 20 minutes and 3 attempts to get butter we left. The room was nice and clean. Everything else was good.

The hotel is very clean and the staff go out of their way to make you feel valued and be helpful in any way possible. The breakfast buffet is a good value and the convenience of shop in the lobby for snacks/drinks is a great idea.

We are a group of 15 friends from Egypt, we took the train to Tanger. The hotel is walking distance from the train station and right next to City Center. Everything is available next to us. The view from the room is breathtaking. The stuff is extremely friendly. Mr.Jaoud the manger was very helpful and welcoming. The breakfast is by far the best one we had in Morocco. The whole experience was supeb. Check in was very easy and smooth. The rooms are spotless clean. Best location in the city. We loved every moment. Thank you Hilton, amazing Job. Will definitely come again.

column3: The Nicest Hilton Garden Inn We've Ever Seen
column4: We had a wonderful stay! Coming from the U.S., our impression of the Hilton Garden Inn line was that they were a step down from the typical Hilton property. We're so happy we didn't pay the extra $100 to stay at the Hilton next door, because this hotel was fantastic! Super clean, seemingly recently upgraded (loved the hardwood floors and showers in the rooms), and a really delicious and hearty breakfast buffet. The location across from the train station couldn't have been more convenient, and it's a short walk to the beachfront/mall, too. If we're ever back in Tangier, we'll certainly return!

Excellent place to stay. All of your needs will be met. Close to the water and many local restaurants. Shopping center next door. A short taxi ride will find you a multitude of other local shops and things to do.

We stayed at this Hilton over Christmas four nights. Overall it has everything a Hilton Garden has. Only minus is the small bathroom. Staff excellent, especially in the breakfast! I can highly recommend it.

We enjoyed our two nights stay. The checked-in was quick and Faoud at the help desk was very helpful to all our questions. He made us feel comfortable knowing that we it was our first time in Tanger. He gave us the information we needed. We appreciate his excellent service. Also, our dining experience was great. The restaurant staff attended to our needs. I gave them 10 out of 10 for doing an excellent service. Our room is spacious and clean especially the bathroom. I love the soft bed and fluffy pillows. We were surprised to see welcome gifts - fruits and pastries on the table when we arrived the first day. stay. The staff are very friendly and hospitable. They are very helpful to all our needs and we felt relaxed and at home. Overall, we had an awesome stay!

The service is just outstanding . Ms Ferdos and Mr Mohammed In front desk are just outstanding . They make you feel at home immediately and they make sure all the needs are met . Upon arriving you get recognized and feels like family home . Again thank you for outstanding service . Also , the security and parking attendant are extremely attentive . Great hotel ...

The hotel was very good and the rooms spacious. Really clean and comfortable with amazing breakfast. The dinner menu though was not as tasty as the breakfast. Also we had to ask for a hairdryer which they brought to the room, they should have one in the room already!

column3: Wonderful Stay... Great Staff, amazing location!
column4: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Tangier. The rooms were spacious and we had a beautiful view! The staff at this hotel are very welcoming and kind. We sat at the hotel lounge and ate at the hotel restaurant twice. The food and hospitality was top notch! This hotel is right off the beach and next to a shopping mall and many restaurants and cafes! We will definitely stay here again when we return!

Easy 2 min walk from Train station. 2 min from beach and other restaurants. Great service. Clean rooms. Breakfast was amazing with lits of choices. Room was right size and bed was perfect. family freindly

Very kind team to an incredible point. Front desk but a special mention to restaurant team during breakfast. Very warm and kind to kids also. Rooms are very well equipped and the proximity to the corniche and the mall make it a good choice

We travelled with a 7 year old and a 2 year old. The room had a fantastic view and the hotel was in a great location. Opposite the railway station, next door to a mall with a supermarket. It's also about 30 minutes from the airport. There is well managed parking right outside the hotel. The only addition I would suggest with the room are tissues! The service was exceptional, Ferdous great at reception, Amal and Rajae were brilliant at breakfast along with a chef kept our active son entertained which allowed us to eat the brilliant breakfast in peace. The cleaner Fatima was efficient and cleaned and tidied our room fantastically. Last but not least was the doorman who was also really good with our son. I would definately recommend this hotel.

We arrived here via bullet train from Rabat. We were able to walk from train station to the hotel. It took about 10 minutes. The check in was very easy. We had booked with Expedia and everything was done correctly. Front desk very helpful with advise about a restaurant. It was excellent.

column3: Great hotel w/ ideal location and extremely courteous staff
column4: The hotel is ideally located next to the beach, which is what initially prompted me to stay here but the best part of my experience was the courteous behavior of the staff, who went out of their way at every step of our stay to make us feel very comfortable.

column3: Very good stay at the Hilton Garden Inn
column4: The hotel staff is very friendly and always helpful. For the hotel guests there are parking places in the parking garage. If not parking would have been very difficult since it is in the city centre close to a big mall. There are multiple ATM machines in the vicinity and the beach is close by with the promenade around the old city centre.

column3: Can’t even give it a passing grade
column4: Reception was disorganized and inefficient. Room was bare! No hairdryer, only one pair of slippers, no Kleenex , No hand towel or wash towel. . Shower with slow drain. Dinning room service pathetic . Food quality was good though. Wifi was okay. Gives a bad name under the Hilton brand. Don’t go there if you can avoid it!

It’s walking distance from the ONCF train station, steps away from Tanger Mall, and oh there’s a Starbucks inside the train station. I was so happy! The hotel is beautiful and the staff was pleasant and accommodating. The hotel is modern, clean, airy, and overall good quality hotel and staff.

A good quality of service and an excellent location. Situated in the center of the city of Tangier, it is an ideal hotel for families or couples. The prices are also affordable for such a good located four stars Hotel.

Amazing hotel, amazing staff, great location and great breakfast buffet. Would stay again, would recommend to a friend/family. Value for money is really good, regular hotel price but the experience is closer to a 4-5 star luxury hotel.

column3: Brand new nice hotel. Good location just across the beach
column4: This is a new hotel. I believe it is about 3 years old. As such the rooms are really nice and spacious. The shower area was new with a glass and their shower amenities of very good quality. We were travelling with a group of 50 people. Dinner was good. Breakfast was ok. The waiters were overwhelmed by the group and were a little bit slow to respond.

My boyfriend & I had an Airbnb booked for one night in Tangier before catching the ferry back to Europe. We arrived in the evening, and our Airbnb host never showed up. After standing on the street in the dark and rain for nearly two hours waiting, we decided to give up and get ourselves a room here instead. The receptionists were SO kind, and after hearing our story, gave us a discounted ocean view room and free breakfast for a very reasonable price. The breakfast was AMAZING! They had a huge selection of food and drinks, and also brought us Moroccan mint tea and fruity chocolate waffles while we ate! They were so so friendly, and we are so glad we made the choice to come here. Huge thank you to the ladies at the front last night!

My family and I had booked to stay in the Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Centre for one night. We were scheduled to land at the Tangier Airport close to midnight and had arranged for a private airport transfer. I received an email confirmation 2 weeks prior to my stay from the assistant front office manager that my private airport transfer in a hotel car had been booked. We landed in Tangier Airport slightly ahead of schedule. After emerging from passport control and baggage collection, I spent 10+ minutes on the phone with the front desk of the hotel. They told me that there was no airport transfer booked for me. It was only when I told them that my private transfer had been confirmed and gave the email from their assistant front office manager that they realized that I should…

We stayed here for 3 nights. Good location and clean. However, some of the staffs treated us unfriendly, rude and unprofessional. We ordered room service for a pasta on 13th October 2019 at night, requesting 1 more fork and 2 more spare bowls for us. The dish delivered with only 1 set of cutlery. We called room service again and asked if the fork and bowls were coming. The staff apologised that she had forgot. I asked if she would send us later. However, only 2 more bowls came after a few minutes. Luckily the deliverer was smart enough to ask if we have other needs. We finally got 1 more set of cutlery directly from the deliverer, which we had requested in the first calling. We were going to catch the bus to Tetouan on 14th October at 8. It’s not a busy morning and no other…

Stayed in the Hilton Garden inn hotel in Tangier city for around 7 nights and ill tell you about my expereience the check in was smooth and quick thanks to a lovely receptionist i believe her name is Fatima Zahra, she checked us in to a brilliant room with ocean view even though i hadn't specifically requested it or payed higher in advance. the hotel is updated with a very modern decor. the room was very clean with with all the major amenities you'd expect for a decent hotel, the staff were always very friendly and helpful, in particular Brahim was attentive every morning during our stay at breakfast. Overall great stay with no complaints, I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're in Tangier, as it you'll have a great stay in a great location to everything you'd…

This Hilton Garden is located on the same block with banks and a four story mall. Great for convenience. Hotel has security at the main door and a fairly attentive staff that speak French and English, probably Spanish as well. Nice buffet dinner and big breakfast. The rooms are large with comfortable beds and nice linens but basic amenities are missing. No hair dryer in the rooms or Kleenex! Ironing board but the iron is gone! But the biggest mistake is the decor. Nothing looks Moroccan or Arabic in either design or decoration. It could easily be a Hilton in Chicago or LA. Not impressed

We had a great stay. Our second stay we stayed in room 1324 and this room had a great sea view. It is in walking distance of great restaurants and the mall. Breakfast was perfect and a lot of variety. Staff at parking, restaurant, housekeeping and frontdesk are all friendly and helpfull. It was our first time staying in this hotel in Tanger. We stayed before in Tanger in other hotels but we are definitely staying our next visits in the future at the Garden Inn. Huseyin

In all my years of travelling I have never stayed at a hotel in the Hilton group & thought to give it a try based on reviews I read in January'19 & its location. There seemed to be a problem with the check-in. After 20 minutes of no communication, I went to enquire if there was a problem. I was ignored & a while later given our card? We had booked a twin & a single room so why one room. They told us they had put all 3 of us in one room!! I refused this & asked them to sort it out as this is not what we had booked or paid for!! Eventually after almost an hour we could go to our rooms. This booking was done 8 months in advance! The beds were comfortable but the bathroom tiny with only shampoo supplied. We had to phone down to request slippers & this took awhile as no one in…

It was nice staying in the Hilton, nice front lobby workers , love the breakfast. Great beds and great location Housekeeping need some help, they did not make my room untill I call them, once they did clean the room it was an ok job, no towels , no coffee ,and the bathroom floor was not clean , still had oils from my feet. Otherwise this hotel was great.

Checked into Hilton Garden Inn for two nights. The folks at the front desk were very pleasant and welcoming. All the staff offered wonderful recommendations for things to do while in the area. Brahim was an absolute rock star in the restaurant. He greeted us each morning with a warm and friendly smile and set the tone for a wonderful day in Tangier. Brahim’s hospitality and incredible service will be the reason we recommend Hilton Garden Inn to family and friends traveling to the area. Thank you Brahim, you’re the best.

Good location, good service. Rooms are in acceptable size. You can easily enjoy walking distance to the beach promenade, the new marina. Few steps to train station that can take you to casa in 2h10 min

It’s not the first time I stayed at the hotel. Most of the times they forget to clean up the room and to pick up the clothes for laundry. They used to say that they found the “do not disturb” outside the door but this is not true. At my last stay I found cockroaches and spiders in my room which is unacceptable for a hotel which name is Hilton!

The service is good sand the staff is very professional and oriented for business travellers regular need without excessive turistical solicitations. Execelent location with see view and close to shopping, super markets and restaurants on a short walking distance.

column3: Excellent location with a brand promise
column4: Nice and comfortable stay. Keeps up to the brand promise. the staff makes and effort as well to keep you comfortable and meet all your needs. Amal, Fatma and Brahmin from the breakfast team made sure to extend their compliments on my bday with a surprise to make it pleasant.

Stayed here for three nights. On arrival at 11 at night receptionist couldn't offer me a standby upgraded room but instead got me the best she could with a partial sea view. Cleaning staff were extraordinarly friendly and would ask if everything was OK. It was 100 per cent of the time. Breakfast team were also great and would say hello and good bye every morning. The hotel rooms are a decent size with a big bathroom consisting of a shower while the TV has many international channels. No BBC just Cnn Or France 24 English if you want English language news Although all great and near the train station as well as beach and supermarket, I probably wouldn't stay here again. Once you have done tangier you don't need to do it again

column3: Everything about this hotel is Mediocre
column4: I would be hard pressed to find two nice things to say about this hotel.The hotel is pretty much right across the street from the train station which was fantastic for us as we were continuing on to Fes. Other than that, save your time and money and stay elsewhere. Upon check in, we went to our room and noticed that it was dirty. The floors needed to mopped, there was hair all over the bathroom. We told the staff on more than one occasion. They promised to do something, but nothing was ever done. The food at breakfast is subpar at best with the high note being the orange juice and mint tea. We only stayed here 2 nights but that was 2 nights too many.

I came to the hotel after a long day trip from Fès. Arrived approximately at 9 and coming up to the room. I realised that there was no remote control for the television. Half an hour later, and after the reception did not answering the phone, on my way to the restaurant I inform the them about and reassured me that they were going to bring one right away. At eleven coming back realise that noone has came and call the reception. Once again they told me that smn was coming with a remote control. After twenty minutes I called again, same answer. After ten minutes one has came with no remote control, no speaking English also and left. After 10 minutes came back with one and realise that the real problem was the television's cable. My wife was sleeping and he was dragging the…

column3: DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET YOUR INFORMATION STOLEN
column4: I stayed here from August 12-15 and booked a room and paid for it on trips.com upon arrival they asked for my credit card as a hold which of course is normal the stay was ok front desk staff is very rude especially a girl name rana that took 3 hours to check me in and to top everything off a week after I left I had a charge for 400$ for the room which I already paid for plus other random charges without my consent which is fraud. My friends room also had items of passport and 1000$ cash taken from the safe. Do not stay here unless you want to be scammed and frauded.

column3: Good hotel with much room for improvement
column4: We were a group of 5 who stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in 2 seperate rooms (for the purposes of this review, Room A and B) It is located right next to the beach and Tangier train station, with a shopping mall next door and a very busy McDonald's. We had mostly a positive experience with staff, especially in the breakfast room, who were very friendly. Staff usually speak Arabic, English and French. The fridge in room A wasn't working properly and it was replaced promptly. However, when we asked for a single bed instead of the sofa bed in the room, they would not remove the sofa bed so we eventually asked for the single bed to be removed as there wasn't space for both. Also, the water was clogging up in the bath and not draining. In Room B, the air conditioning was a…

Had to wait for over a half hour after 3:00 am at the parking and be asked to leave the garage because there was no parking spot. Called the reception no answer and had to exist the garage and leave my car on the street.

Clean rooms. Staff helpful. The breakfast menu was a bit limited but of decent quality. Only one of the four coffee machines was working. But, overall good value for money. I would go back if travelling to Tangier.

Ferdaouss who apparently is the reservations manager has an attitude that requires her to go back to learning how to deal with “clients” of the hotel. She was rude, unhelpful and incredibly sarcastic - also talking in Arabic in front of me and quite clearly about me. We had to wait more than an hour for our rooms and she want very nice when we enquired “how much longer ?” The rooms are adequate but the wait and her attitude sadly dud not make for a nice beginning of our holiday. If that is what and how the Hilton chain want to represent themselves then we won’t be using them again.

This July we stayed twice in Garden in a total of 10 days or more. Ferdos and Mohammed at front desk are wonderful. They recognized us immediately they were very kind to my family of 5 needs. Always they go out of the way to help. The restaurants service is wonderful Meriam , Raja , Mohammed , few other I forgot there names from the cook to cleaners are just wonderful people. The made us welcome and felt at home. They made sure my kids get the perfect Waffles and when my three year old made mess every morning the were kind ready to help. The hotel is family friendly and welcoming . In Madrid hotels panic when they see toddlers and you would get stare. We thank management for great team Ferdos and Mohammed have top notch customer service skills. One day they will run the hotel.

column3: Save your money and stay away!
column4: After spending many days in Spain, we decided to choose this hotel because of the reputation name « Hilton » but everything was catastrophic. As I am manager of 5 stars hotels and general of travel agency I will never come back here and I will never recommend it to my clients. I came with my family so I choose the family suite with two interconnected rooms as described in my reservation and I paid more than 300 euros per night because I want to enjoy my holiday with my family in tangier...but so shame! When I came the first surprise there is no place for my car in the parking of the hotel that was paid in my booking!!! they suggest to park my car in the parking of the mall. Second and the big surprise is in the reception they said they don’t have family suite with two rooms as…

The amenities were excellent. Good location too. Breakfast was good but the staff working at breakfast area seem unfriendly and judging. On our way out we were approached by one of the unsmiling staff and asked us to give them a good review on hilton app. I said i would give an 8 and she said that was too low and if I could make it higher. Strange. But still a good hotel just ignore staff.

5 stars hotel with the best view of Europe from Africa and two differents bodies of water Atlantic Ocean and mediterranean sea. top security, good food, friendly workers, cleanness all over and an excellent location.

Very nice hotel with great location and services staff was very helpful both at reception and breakfast restaurant. I will recommend Hilton Garden inn for anyone visiting Tangier if they to enjoy their stays

Staff at receptionists are always welcoming with a warm smile. They are efficient and very helpful. Every time I reach to them for help or a question, i find them more than happy to help out. Very good variety of options in Breakfast restaurant. Staff are also very helpful and extra nice. They are always on top of your service. Rooms are well maintained with nice view. Location is very unique and can't be compromised. Close to everything. Train station, taxis, malls, grocery stores, restaurants, beach, etc. Always has been a very pleasant experience for me, the reason I keep going back to it.

column3: Slow lifts nice location close to beach.
column4: Room 426 Luxury layout king singles. First hotel that gave x 2 free small bottles of water in room Aircon tricky woke up hot in the middle of the night. Elevators useless only carry 4 people at once. One wait was over 4 min for lift. To get from 4th floor to lobby Hit water kettle supplied with tea and coffee in room. Good breakfast good choice of foods. Fire alarms went off several times jamming lifts open. Further inconvieniencing patrons.

Stayed there on several business trips in Tanger. The place is really nice, very well located, close to the train station and the beach. Rooms are clean, comfortable and quite new. Staff is friendly and efficient. Definitively a very good hotel for a business stay in the region.

I stayed two night in this hotel , it location is perfect next to the beach and train station. It was busy in EID holiday , they have underground parking, overall experience very nice from check in to check out, the breakfast was good and the girls at the breakfast reception very nice and welcoming and so are the waiters very helpful. Very nice stay at this Hilton.

2 Minutes Walk To The Beach. There We Rode Horses And Enjoyed A Very Lovely walk Along The Beach. The Hotel Is 2 Minutes Away From A Mall And Supermarket, And A Train Station Is 4 Minutes Away. There You Can Board A Train That Can Take You To Casablanca And Marrakesh. Great Location.

I really enjoyed the time I spent in this magnificent hotel. The location and the room view to the sea was spectacular. However the food was not so good. Service was average. Spacious rooms very bright and modern

Excellent staff excellent service Delicious cuisine Confortable room Excellent location In dining room start at 5:00 pm till 11:00pm ! I hope for 24/24 AC remote not useful very difficult to use Carpet in corridor need cleaning !

As a regular guest of Hilton hotels, I have stayed at Hilton Garden Inn Tangier/Morocco, I was impressed by this hotel location and service, regarding the location, this hotel is near to the sea, which makes it very special hotel in this vibrant city, especially in summer, all attractions are near and restaurants, McDonald’s just next door, shopping centre on the neath of the hotel,train station opposite, on general myself and my family loved this hotel, the room was very clean, staff were very kind and helpful, breakfast was excellent different choices. I will definitely book again this hotel, and I will recommend it to all my family and friends.

column3: Not what I would expect from a Hilton Garden Inn
column4: Food service was poor. Customer service overall was average which is I guess common thing in Morocco. So be prepared if you come visit the country. Otherwise the rooms were clean and parking staff was very curious and friendly.

column3: Excelent Hotel in the middle of Tanger near to the sea.
column4: First of all i'd like to thank everyone of the staff for the professional, nice & friendly way welcoming their guest. Starting with Receptionists, cuisine staff & house keeping ,, many thanks for making my & other guests stay that easy & comfortable. Not to mention that Hotel in the heart of Tangier city so close to sea & TGV station too I do recommend the place for who want a comfortable, pleasant stay at Tangier.

This is a lovely hotel in a good location (the new train station is half a block away). The breakfast buffet is great with lots of options. The beds are comfortable, and the rooms are clean. If it’s rainy or you are tired, there is TV in several languages in the room.

Location It’s located just opposite the train station, and below the tanger mall. Walking distance from the seaside. There bus 14 to reach the Médina. (3.5dh per person). If not you can go there with taxi. Room Room is very clean and bright. Love the rooms. Check in time is 3pm. Service Staff speaks very good English. Service is top notch. Highly recommend this hotel.

column3: Feels like a five star hotel in-terms of great location & facilities but staff service quality requires improvements
column4: The hotel is located in a very good location, it is very close to the train station and has excellent sea view as well as many restaurants to eat near by. The hotel feels very new and the room are clean and spacious, however the staff service quality is not up to Hilton standards yet. When I first checked in the room, the front desk insist I haven’t pay in full yet for my booking, until I strongly insist they rechecked again, then they found out it was their mistake. Later when I enter the room around 7pm, my room was not cleaned yet, I see the staff is still trying to make up the beds from last guest. Then I found out the room was missing slippers and hair dryer which I requested half hour ago and still not send to my room yet, I had to call twice for the same request. Also the…

Wonderful hotel in a perfect location. Staff in this hotel are second to none. Breakfast spread was excellent and dinner a la carte menu is very good. Would definitely stay here again when in Tangier.

Have to say I’m a big fan of Tangier anyway but stepping out the train station to see the hotel in front was great. Check in easy and room spotless. Didn’t get a high floor but windows were super sound proof. Shower was lovely and powerful. Bar area downstairs was great and thought the breakfasts were the best in Morocco, although have to say the lack of Moroccan tea was a shame. Was a great stay and when I’m next in tangier will be staying again

First time in Morocco, here for business trip. I stepped out of the train station and i was looking for a taxi to go to hotel. I could not find anybody that speaks English well, strangely, i was told that taxis do not give receipts. I felt the need of double checking because it was not logical not giving a receipt and taxis all around the world tend to cheat. I looked for someone who can explain me this, tried to talk few people including police. None could speak english well. Desperately i saw Hilton Hotel right across the train station. Hoped someone could know english there. Thanks to Mr. Mounir from reception, although he knew i will be staying in another hotel, in a friendly way spare time for me and verified the no receipt system. He also called a honest taxi driver who…

Check-in was friendly and welcoming, but a key request made at check-in was not communicated. We had an early morning check-out, and requested "to go" breakfast bags. The woman at the front desk acknowledged that. Imagine our surprise when, at 5:30 the next morning, with a taxi waiting to take us to the airport for our 8 am flight, no breakfast bags! So, although the rooms were lovely and we liked the location, service is equally as important. (Kudos to the early morning reception staff that jumped into action and got us those bags - you rock!)

We stayed here for two nights and the property is nothing short of superb, the staff are off the charts great on customer service, the bar is a nice place to relax, and overall it just a great place. Well worth the stay and if we go back to Tangiers, we will definitely consider staying here again.

Stayed in this hotel in Feb 2019. Staff is extremely helpful and hospitable. As an HHonors member, we received a free upgrade to a room on the 7th floor, facing the Atlantic ocean. We also received a free breakfast. Their facilities are well maintained, room was huge. Wifi is fast. Location is great, near the water and also near a mall. There is also a TGV station within walking distance. Breakfast had excellent selection. We highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

Stayed there at Hilton Garden Inn Tangier for one night and I would give them 4 stars for the next reasons, good location, brand new building, good wifi connection, super cool view of the city, big flat screen telly. They lost one star because of the breakfast. Had an incident while I went to get the fruits salad (so the should improve the display of the breakfast items..

This is a dedicated compliment to restaurant hostess “Nassima” for her warm welcoming and kind hospitality during our whole stay. She was always pleased to serve and help us as much as she can, with a big bright smile on her face. She never forgot to serve everyday on breakfast a complimentary welcoming fruit or desserts dish. Also, I cannot forget to mention our hostess on last day “Rajae”. Please make sure to share this message with them directly.

What wonderfully welcoming staff and such a refreshing change from other hotels I had stayed in during my visit to Morocco. The food and drinks manageress and her staff made me extremely welcome and Sarah was so kind. Our group of 7 friends were given free mint tea and I placed photographs about the hotel experience on my food blog.

The hotel and staff were amazing at this property. Upon arrival and seeing how big my family was, they upgraded us to a king size suite on the top floor which was incredibly spacious. All the staff members knew us by name (probably because we were diamond members) and were very accommodating; especially during dining time. They offered us a private tour of Tangier which was very relaxing and not rushed at all. The location was perfect because as soon as you went outside, the mall was right next door and around the corner was another Hilton property in case you wanted to access different Restaurants and the swimming pool. You could very easily walk on the beach which was less than 5 minutes away and if you had time, can take a boat over ti spain which was approximately 45…

What a nice encounter! We finished an overnight train journey from Marrakech to Tangier. Upon walking out of Tangier train station in early morning at 7am, we wish to have a decent place for breakfast. None inside the station. After a few steps of walk, we discovered HILTON! What an oasis! We decided to enjoy a luxurious breakfast. Although we later realised it's not the five-star Hilton we thought, we were not disappointed as the buffet breakfast was very nice. Views excellent overlooking the sea and mountains. We watched the sunrise views. Food good with variety. Ambience very cozy spacious and clean. We spent a quite number of hours here with our suitcases stored at their storeroom on the same floor as the breakfast. Service good too. The staff speak good English. …

Here I found the best staff ever. Kindness and professionality. It was the first time I felt sad to leave. They made me feel home. During my four days stay my 15 month baby girl had high fever. They were all so sensitive and available in every respect. I strongly recommend this hotel. And many thanks to all the staff. ❤️❤️❤️

Hi Quality service as expected on Hilton brand, but the Staff was most helpful and, above expectations. The Breakfast was spectacular e with an huge offer but, surprise-ling, the mini-bar at the rooms was totally empty.

column3: What you expect - good for families
column4: Just had two nights at this property and room was standard and clean. Breakfast buffet included in our rate had good variety and an egg station. This is a very good property for families/kids/teens and there are a lot of them. Adjacent to a McDonalds and a food court at the mall next door. The beach area is an easy walk with a lot of entertainment options. A better hotel option for mobility needs since this and the sister property on the other side of the mall have elevators. Staff was helpful and nothing to fault if you are looking for a non-riad stay in Tangier.

We booked 2 nights at the hotel the day before we were due to arrive and had no problems finding a good price. We were given a lovely room on arrival with views of the ocean. The room was a good size and came with kettle etc. for in room tea/coffee making (much appreciated by us!). I didn't have a hairdryer the first morning but asked at reception and one was delivered. The hotel is a very short walk from Tanger Ville train station where we had arrived from Casablanca on the fast train. There are lots of places to eat nearby the hotel and along the Corniche. A lovely place to stay!

Friendly and helpful staff especially Meryem at reception. We appreciated our room upgrade. We would also like to thank the restaurant staff for their professional service and the cheffs for the delicious food. Heartfelt thanks go also to house keeping for keeping the rooms spotlessly clean. We always feel in this facility as if we are in our place.

This is a great hotel. About 20 minute drive from the airport. They do not have a shuttle to the airport but you can request they arrange a taxi for you. The cost is about 250MAD vs 150-200MAD if you arrange a ride on your own. They are very clear about this when you make the request and you can decide if the convenience is worth it for you. There are security staff and a metal detector on your way in. I’m not used to this but I appreciated it, made me feel safe. The front desk staff were very pleasant and always ready and willing to help. The rooms are spacious and clean. The ocean view is really a must! The hotel is located in a wonderful area - walking distance to the boardwalk, mall, and train station. We enjoyed local food and great views. We unfortunately did not…

From start to finish this hotel was superb. When we travel, we typically do not stay in big,name brand hotels. We decided however to stay at a Hilton for one night to end our stay in Morocco. We wish we could have spent more time here. From start to finish the staff was amazing. They went out of their way to be helpful and even remembered our names. The rooms are large and clean. The breakfast was abundant and delicious. I recommend this hotel 100%.

column3: Great service from both front desk and restaurant staff
column4: We found that this Hilton is not standard like other Hilton properties around the world. We reserved an ocean-view room but did not have a full ocean-view (only saw a corner of the ocean). Room amenities were quite basic. I was surprised that there was no hair dryer in the room. I had to call the front desk to request one which I never had to do at any American chain hotels! We had breakfasts for two mornings, and frankly, their breakfast selections were limited. However, the staff at the restaurant were providing great service. One of the female servers remembered on the second morning that I had mentioned my coffee was hot the day before, and personally prepared cappuccinos for me (instead of from the machine). When we left the restaurant after breakfast (both mornings), a…

column3: Great stay at a lovely hotel
column4: My girlfriend and I were very impressed with the level of hospitality we received at the Hilton Garden Inn in Tangier. The restaurant supervisor in particular was very friendly, offering us tasty Moroccan mint tea and sweets. He really made our stay very memorable. The entire staff was very attentive and helpful. I would highly recommend the day trip the hotel offers to the blue city! All in all, we really enjoyed our stay here.

We had a great stay at the Garden Inn in Tangier. It was the experience we expected from a Hilton hotel, with the exception of hotel staff which were exceedingly welcoming, friendly, and helpful above expectations from a large hotel. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Internet was dependable. The breakfast was tasty and extensive. The hotel is in a nice area, close to the shoreline and across the street from the train station though rather far from the Medina (30 minute walk or short taxi ride). Also next to a large mall. In summary, we had a pleasant experience at the Hilton Garden Inn. This is a much different experience than you would have staying in the Medina at a Riad, but is a comfortable alternative next to the train station.

Enjoyed my stay at this lovely hotel. The staff at the front desk, housekeeping and the restaurant was simply outstanding. In my many many nights at hotels around the world, I have never experienced such hospitality. Nicely located next to the shopping mall and new high speed rail station. You have access to public transportation and the many taxis. Would highly recommend this hotel and great staff. Oh yes the rooms very lovely and beds super comfortable...

column3: Amazing hotel and staff with a personal touch
column4: Myself and my husband stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and loved our stay. This is the best hotel experience we both ever had. The location is close to the beach and right next to a mall and supermarket. The room was very comfortable and modern. The internet in the room was very fast. What we really enjoyed was having breakfast every morning with the wonderful staff. They really got to know us and what we liked for breakfast. Rajae was wonderful and would bring my husband his coffee every morning as he was sitting down. The entire staff was amazing, warm and very welcoming. It feels great being so valued by everyone.

This is a wonderful hotel,it’s in a great location close to a shopping mall,if it’s raining it’s a short walk,with food outlets. The hotel has the best staff I have encountered in a hotel,from the minute you walk in. By the second day they all knew me by name which was impressive I have only had that at the Langham hotels. Rooms are clean and tidy,most with nice views. The breakfast was exceptional,good choices on food,but most of all the staff were very attentive from the minute you walk in, In particular I have to mention just a couple who went out of their way to look after me, Nasima,Raja and mr Mouataz,a very big thank you to them,that’s just a few but all the hotel staff I have to say are great WELL DONE HILLTON!!! You have a great team and I can’t wait to come back.

We have stayed in many Hiltons around the world, but this was the 'greatest' experience we have ever encountered during a stay. The entire staff was amazing from being checked-in until being checked-out. However, in particular the breakfast staff was the most memorable for us; our family will never forget the quality service, genuine friendliness, and the great interactions with everyone in this crew of professionals. Nadir not only provided us great Moroccan Tea and breakfast, but also took the time to get to know us and entertain our family from day one until we left. Additionally, Ema was very friendly and ensured we were satisfied with the food (which was delicious!) and service there. The lead (his name escapes me now) there also very engaging and offered us advice about…

I recently stayed with a travel group to visit some sites in the Tangier area. Our experience with the HGI was very nice. The front desk staff was excellent, very friendly and efficient for all our needs. I will play to stay here again.

Typical Hilton. Good service. Good breakfast with excellent service. Parking on the street which was secured by the hotel. The greatest attraction for this hotel is its location.Beautiful seaviews from our room.Good restaurants around the hotel and a mall 100meters from the hotel.

As a group of six who were just starting our adventure tour of Morocco, our agent chose this hotel for us. What a wonderful surprise...don't know what I was expecting but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and the restaurant was fabulous. Food was superb both at dinner and breakfast-time.

column3: Best option for the moment under quality versus pricing rates
column4: Location is very much convenient on access and neighborhood's offers. New building sets on an interesting and pleasant decoration, 4 elevators available, restaurant correspond to the expected level, free wifi with sufficient and stable signal, front desk efficient and professionally welcomes guests, check in & out very short and accurate.

column3: Very Nice, Modern, good location Hotel
column4: On Oct 2018 my husband and I stayed overnight at the Hilton Garden Inn Tanger. I was really hesitant on spending the night in Tanger with all the bad reviews online. It was an incredible experience for us. Just perfect. The hotel looks like new. Nice breakfast buffet. The lobby is really nice, the staff was very friendly and efficient. LOCATION: The hotel is in a very nice area of Tanger. You can walk to the beach where you can find cafes and restaurants. And the most important shopping mall is at walking distance too. ROOMS: Our room has two double beds. Good size room, good vibe, nice furniture. - Views: We had really nice views of the beach. - Illumination: The room it’s very well illuminated, lots of lamps and spots. Just how I like it. - Beds: Very comfortable beds.…

The Hilton Garden Inn was our oasis at the end of a long road in Morocco. We really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were clean, quiet, spacious, and had great hot water/pressure. We had an amazing water view from the 11th floor. The breakfast was delicious and the staff was friendly and kind. We wouldn’t hesitate to come back.

An exceptional hotel located in a very beautiful area and with an exceptional panorama. The breakfast was very rich and tasty, the staff very nice, thank you very much for the cleanliness for the offered service thank you very nice to the reception, especially the two beautiful girls beautiful girls Assia and Didi and especially the girl from Sara bar. Thank you very much for your beautiful performance and kindness. I wish you beautiful and beautiful days of wonderful customers and tourists.

column3: Stay in a riad this is impersonal and with out character
column4: Curtain rail broken lifts so slow and small took us 20 mins from level4 to ground floor .buffet on level 1 a la carte on level 0 so we got relocated...we arrived from nz with back packs we might as well have had 2 heads and green ears... find somewhere else to stay...we went to the ibis next door to have dinner!!!!

We stayed there last week for 4nights was amazing,staff are so friendly and willing to help the location is just 2 min from the cornich, the food is so tasty we had the breakfast at the 15th floor restaurant it’s just no comment...a typical moroccan breakfast Briefly worth visit you won’t regret Thanks Hilton for the memorable stay will definitely come back

This is a typical Hilton Garden Inn. The staff is oh so polite and helpful. Rooms impeccable. Just steps away from the beach and wide promenade....and a mall just feet away. If you need a grocery store, you’ll find it there. Rooms have mini-fridges.

Had a great time at Hilton in Tangier Morocco, Chafika and Amal, always did a great job with my room, if I had any questions they were always able to help and point me in the right direction, will visit the Hilton again for my travels

column3: excellent location.. good recognition to Hilton Honor membrs
column4: This hotel is my home in tangier ..The location is excellent just few steps to the shopping mall .. MacDonald's ..coffee shops , restaurant , and a shisha ( Hookah ) places If you are shisha smoker ,, and the beach .so your are in the center of tangier .. The staff are very nice ,, smiling ,,welcoming .. and with lovely behavior . special Thanks to Ms. Fatima al Zahra from the front desk for her co operation , helping . and to Ms. Hajar from the restaurant ,, for her warm welcome and extra-ordinary service she provide during breakfast time , which was rich with a lot of varieties . the rooms are very clean .. bed is comfortable .. the view from my room to the sea was amazing . Recognition and Honor to Hilton honor members ( Good 7/10 )

Nice and clean rooms! I am very satisfied! Thank you for the excellent housekeeping service Chafika! I can recommend everybody that is visiting tanger to stay at this hotel. PS: if you have the choice to include breakfast then do it!

column3: Nice location, rooms, but very slow and pricy.
column4: I am regular customer to Hilton hotels around the world... the services in this location is the slowest one and improper resources management is very clear ( I lost + 2.5 hours in check-in & checkout for 10 hours stay ) with only few guest in the line. Also the elevator is slow and busy most of the time. The breakfast was good and has some Moroccan dishes and the services level in the restaurant is much better than front desk ( thanks goes to Raja as well ). Location is supper and has big supermarkets, mall, telecom, and walk few steps to beach, cafes and restaurants.

Arrived at 4:00. We had to wait over one hour for our room. Unfortunately, one of us was needing to rest due to fever. We waited it out quietly. Finally got to our room and as we arrived housekeeping was leaving. The floors were all wet and there were no pillowcases or towels....yet. So much for the needed rest before dinner. It is now 7:00 and we still haven’t received everything. Waiting to shower for our 8:00 reservation. Annoying, indeed. Staff is very friendly but completely inefficient. Stay somewhere else. We were considering this hotel for a sales meeting. No longer.

Very nice service in 5 level I enjoy special with hous keeping girls they are very worker names fatma zahra and chafika good continuation.and I like very well this service and the restaurant was very good services and they are very gentil they went to helep I like very mutch .

Ilham chafika and imane are great girls , make every stay a little beter. This hotel is a great place to stay in tangier. The location is perfect close to the center and hart of tangier. I Will come back for sure

column3: great central location, clean rooms and breakfast with good variety
column4: Great location, ten minutes from the pier where the ferry arrives to from Spain, its one of the better locations if you wanna stay nearby the center. Staff is pleasant, professional and speaks fluent english in addition to french n arabic of course. Rooms are nice n clean, would love to have a seawiew which we didn't get which was a little bummer. breakfast was delicious and variated, you dont feel like leaving but at some point u have to. The lady in the reception was very helpful picking out a driver for a day sightseeing and bargained us a deal much better than what the brochures, the tourist board at the pier and a lot of the internet advise you to, big thumb of for the extra assistanse to the reception. An alright gym and nearby ness to a lot makes this hotel worth staying…

Im very satisfied services offered by bartender Sara. Recommend trust this hotel. أنا مسرور جدا من الخدمات التي يقدمها نادل سارة. أوصي بشدة بهذا الفندق. أنا أيضا مسرور جدا مع موظفي هذا الفندق. هم الرقيقة جدا والودية I am also very pleased with the staff of this hotel. They are very kind and friendly

Everything is ok and we are pleasure to deal more and more time . We met Elham which is very kindly and helpful And everything is ok like breakfast, dinner but we need a swimming pool . Also we need pharmacy working 24 hours.

We are just leaving the Tangier Hilton Garden Inn after 8 nights of a simply perfect stay. My partner was here on business, so I and our two little ones tagged along to accompany her. This hotel is wonderful for both families and business types. -The walls and doors are thick, so we never heard a sound from other guests (and I hope they never heard my baby who woke up early). -The parking is on site in a well-guarded and well-lit subterranean garage. -rooms were relatively large for Tangier (this is our 3rd trip Tangier in two months. I used to come to Tangier frequently a decade earlier). -this is, without exception, the cleanest hotel I’ve stayed in in over 12 years of traveling to Morocco -the views of the Bay of Tangier are breathtaking What really made the stay wonderful…

column3: Affordable rates for a luxurious experience
column4: The hotel is located at 200 meters from the beach, walking distance to the activities and tons of restaurants. Paying HHonor points for the room is a great deal. Plus I got an upgrade to an ocean view room - the view to Gilbraltar was exceptional! The breakfast was wonderful too.

Hotel right next to the beach. I come here often, and the staff is first class. Withdraw, if there should be any, would be. That there is no pool. But hey, the ocean is right next to you "beggars can't be choosers" ;-)greetings to the staff.

column3: Great place for business visits or city break in Tangiers
column4: Great place for business visits or city breaks in beautiful Tangiers. Clean rooms, very professional staff, gentle, especially welcoming and helpful Houda at B’fast Restaurant... Recommend for Tangiers lovers

Great location near the beach. Good food and bar if you just want to relax. Can’t ask for a better friendlier staff. Rooms were above my expectations. Will choose this hotel again next time in town. Great job

This hotel is very good and security you can stay with relax mind also the house keeping for rooms it was perfect and all the stuff friendly more over self service laundry is available. You can go to the beach only walking for 5 minutes.

This hotel had special rooms for disabled persons, although there was no ocean view and I changed rooms to get one. Nice and clean, with a friendly and helpful staff. I don't much like this new section of the city, and find the kasbah much more Moroccan and much more fun.

the stay was great - everybody was genuinely friendly and caring - I would like to Thank Abdelkader - the Front Office Manager - who made our stay special and helped us in many aspects of our stay. He is a true ambassador of the hotel and a real credit to a company.

We were in Tangier for just a couple of days and stayed here. It’s a beautiful new hotel. The staff spoke English and were very nice. The room was nice and big and comfortable. We had breakfast included and it was fabulous! We had a great stay and I would recommend. It’s a taxi ride to the Medina but it was pretty close and very inexpensive. The only issue we had was that the elevators weren’t working very well!

Staff are so friendly and helpful feeling home and definitely will come back again.. great location nearby everything and nice view on the strait of Gibraltar... great service and hospitality especially housekeeping/ lalla Ilham 😍🤩😍

column3: Comfortable Hotel suited for a business trip
column4: Hotel in a good location with some good restaurants and fast food places nearby. Short walk to the corniche and a supermarket conveniently located in the building next door. Rooms are big and clean, internet is fast in case you need the internet to work from the room. Good spread for breakfast as well.

Good food, welcome and kind personnel. Optimum position close to downtown and close to the beach. In particular, very efficient and professional House Keeping Supervisor, Mrs. Soukaina. The hotel where for sure you wish to come back one day.

I stayed here one night on my way from Morocco back to Spain. Had a terrific walk along the beach, lots to see and plenty of places to stop for a beer or a bite to eat. Comfortable hotel, good breakfast. I had a nice view looking south along the beach.

Spending one week in Tangier - my first time in Morocco - was fully okay by choosing this accomodation which was a perfect choice! In front of the entrance there are security guards taking cares about guests' safety, By entering the lobby you will find a quite wide receiption desk with minimum 2, but sometimes 4 person who take care on you. My check-in was smooth and fast. The man at front-desk spoke very well English and was able to answer any question I had. They configured my room-card within a few minutes and meanwhile informed me about the breakfast possibilities and timing as well as fitness room possibilities. (this last one I have not tried, but should be okay as I meet lot of persons in the litfs wearing sport suites and going to floor 3, fitness room/gym. The room…

We enjoyed every moment. The amenities met expectations. The staff and service were warm and courteous. The food was par excellence . The Assistant F And B Manager would greet you daily with that infectious smile and attentive to every need .

We came from Marrakesh by the overnight train and reached the station early morning around six and took a stroll to this hotel with our wheelchair elderly, less than 5 mins. We were welcome by the staff and helping us with our bags. We were happy with the rooms and the views with everything functionally good in the rooms. We could get taxi easily right in front of the hotel at reasonable fare.

Arriving from Chef Chaouene we had booked just for a night. We had to catch a train to Casablanca next morning. It could not have been better located. By the beach which offered an expansive tree lined promenade and close to restaurants and pubs. My booking was not direct as I had encountered problem with the hotel portal. The girl at the reception told us that the privileges of Hilton HHonors members are available only on direct booking. Yet she got us a great corner room with fabulous view of the sea and beach on two sides. Thoughtfully designed and appointed room with all that we required. The bar and restaurant had a cosy ambience and lively and enthusiastic staff. Loved it.

We just loved this hotel ! Service is outstanding ! Efficient and professional with a smile. We stayed in a suite that was huge with amazing views from all rooms . Seems like all Rooms face the ocean . Just beautiful ! The hotel is right on the oceanfront with a great «  corniche » where you can walk for miles . The hotel is new with all amenities . Free parking included . The breakfast buffet was very plentiful and offered everything you could want including made to order omelettes , all kinds of delicious hot breakfast food , French pastries, Moroccan pastries etc.. the fitness room is well equipped . Everything is new . Next to the hotel is a great new mall and close by is the train station . Overall a wonderful stay in a beautiful hotel with great service ! Will definitely…

An amazing stay from top to bottom. Perfectly placed property, excellent staff and the best breakfast spread I've ever had. They helped me out in numerous ways and were so kind. I was floored with how good this property and personal were. I stayed here once and then came back after Chefchaouen simply because it was that good.

I stayed in a room on the 8th floor with 3 of my friends. I’m satisfied with the cleanliness of the room. It was comfortable, clean and well kept. However, I’d have to say I was a little bit disappointed that we had to wait quite a while for check in. Lucky that there was a mall nearby for us to pass time. Overall, good hotel to stay, well located!

I confirm ALL the positive points from my previous review… and I am pleased to report that the service has improved considerably. Staff is MUCH more friendly, fast and professional, and catered to all my requests and needs immediately and quickly. Training has certainly improved tremendously in this hotel since my previous stay… therefore, I have now upped my grading to what it deserves… 5 points on T.A. I must mention also the fact that the cleaning staff are an asset to this hotel, still keeping this place spotless. Once again, breakfast was amazing, with choices for every personal taste… and that fresh cooking station is certainly a plus in this hotel. The only thing that I would recommend, would be that you serve FRESH orange juice… I dislike industrial juices… and this…

column3: Best Hotel in the city, good value
column4: The room is clean rooms, with a nice sea view.Thel internet is strong and breakfast and has a wide variety for 4 star hotel .Location close to the mall with a lot of shops, banks and close to many coffee shops and restraunts. Staff are friendly and helpful.

column3: One of the best hotels in town!!
column4: Clean new room & facilities, quite hotel, sophisticated & tasty food and last but not least a very involved, watchful & pampering staff. Hats off!!! The price/quality ratio is definitely one of the best in town

column3: Make sure you include breakfast in your booking !
column4: If you are coming into Tangier from the East there are some roadworks as of March 2018, which caused me to park in the new 5* Hilton’s underground car park. One of the reception staff came and helped me to park in the Hilton Garden’s section, difficult to find as there is a huge underground area for the two Hilton’s and a new shopping mall. Outside to the left there is a bureau de change and the entrance to the mall, fairly good by local standards - but if driving to the airport leave enough time to pop into Marjane - a hyper market on the N1 just a short driving distance to the airport. The hotel room was excellent with temperature control and hardly any noise from a/c. Large bathroom too, with mirror that must have a bit of heating as condensation clears rapidly in the central…

I came to Tangier on a business trip and was required to extend my visit 3 times. During this 6 week stay, the entire hotel staff here went above and beyond to insure I was comfortable so that I could focus on my work. I especially wish to thank the restaurant staff for their service and hospitality. After a long and stressful day, I could always look forward to a wonderful meal served by the attentive and friendly staff. I also wish to express gratitude to housekeeping, security and the lobby staff for their outstanding service. I will miss everyone and already am look forward to returning to Morocco and staying at this hotel.

So so pleased we booked this hotel as our final stop in Morocco. It was amazing. We were thinking of upgrading to the Hilton next door but thought we would save the money, I’m so pleased we did, such great value. The breakfast was amazing, the service fantastic (they even came to the table to advise us the buffet was closing and gave us the chance to get anything else before closing it). The manager came around at breakfast to make sure everything was satisfactory. The room was a great size, nice and clean, toiletries were brilliant (they even included conditioner), WiFi was great, shower pressure was good and beds comfy. We even got a bit of a sea view (if you looked out and to the left!) Definitely book this hotel

We stayed two nights bookending our trip to Morocco. The parking of the rental car was free as was the breakfast. The breakfast was excellent and we enjoyed it. The staff was extremely helpful and kind and security was very good. The facilities were excellent and comfortable. We highly recommend. Also, most of the staff speaks english and arabic and some french and spanish.

We arrived just after 3pm and our room wash ready for check in. The first room they gave us was quite small as there are 3 small children staying with (1, 3 & 4 years).
